item.title: Ellipsis Recommends: Leadership on the Line
item.description:
Ellipsis Recommends: Leadership on the Line

Today, here's a recommendation for your end of summer reading list - Leadership on the Line by Marty Linsky & Ronald A. Heifetz. OVERVIEW Linsky & Heifetz avoid the rose colored glasses point of view when it comes to leadership. Instead, they delve deep into the risks and "dangers" of leadership.

item.title: Writing Website Copy That Works
item.description:
Writing Website Copy That Works

Your website is the world's window into your business and your 24-hour salesperson. Web copy needs to be persuasive feel like a direct conversation with the reader. That's not an easy balance to strike, so we've put together some tips for how you can make your website copy really work for you.

item.title: Mastering Your First E-book
item.description:
Mastering Your First E-book

So, you know you need to write an e-book. tells you it's a great way to collect opt-ins and raise your brand profile. And you know they're right. But you're stuck . It all seems so overwhelming. Perhaps you even have a topic idea (and it's good, too), but you just have no idea how to start.

item.title: Let Them See You Sweat
item.description:
Let Them See You Sweat

There's an old adage about leadership that seems to permeate even the newest of leaders - never let them see you sweat. But emerging research tells us that good leadership means just the opposite. Letting your team "see you sweat" (i.e.

item.title: They Didn't Write That? 6 Surprising Ghostwritten Works
item.description:
They Didn't Write That? 6 Surprising Ghostwritten Works

From legislation to key scholarly pieces to fiction, ghostwriters have played a key part in literary production. Most ghostwriters are never revealed, but recently the topic has hit public consciousness again with stories involving a few social icons. With everyone all abuzz, we thought we'd take a look at some works you might be surprised to find out were ghostwritten.

item.title: 4 Tips for Hosting a Guest Blogger
item.description:
4 Tips for Hosting a Guest Blogger

Being a guest blogger and hosting a guest blogger are great ways to build traffic for your website and build great relationships in the ether world. We talked about how to become a guest blogger . Today, let's talk a little bit about how to host a guest blogger.

item.title: How One Well Executed Message Can Reach Millions
item.description: How One Well Executed Message Can Reach Millions

item.title: The Art of a Content Marketing Strategy
item.description:
The Art of a Content Marketing Strategy

Before you're ready to hire a writer, there's a necessary step - Strategy (with a capital S). Ghostwriters, like those of us here, can help tell your story, but without a cohesive strategy in place and story is just that - . The "s-word" might sound overwhelming, but there are excellent resources available to help you get started.

item.title: 5 Things Creative People Wish Their Leader Knew
item.description:
5 Things Creative People Wish Their Leader Knew

If you experience a little misgiving at hiring, collaborating or managing a "creative-type," chances are you don't self identify as "creative." You might find creatives flighty or mystifying... but, trust us, you need each other. A little understanding can go a long way in making the working relationship between a self-identified "creative" and "not creative" an enriching, mutually refueling experience.

item.title: Tips and Tricks for Becoming a Guest Blogger
item.description:
Tips and Tricks for Becoming a Guest Blogger

Guest blogging not only brings targeted traffic to your website, it also helps establish you as an expert and an expert who has the tacit support of the host. This is a powerful combination that helps you build valuable relationships with people in your niche.
